item.title: Syria's Use of Chemical Warfare
item.dc:creator: @Mikeyzzz Mikeyzzz
item.description:
@Mikeyzzz wrote:

[quote=“Bowser jr, post:2, topic:521648”]No. Both sides are accused for using chemical weapons, and why make that the red line? If anything we should support Assad.[/quote]My family all come from Syria, Assad is the only person that is doing anything beneficial for the country, which he should, seeing as though he is the countries leader. In regards to the chemical warfare: Assad is not the one responsible for such actions, it is the terrorists. My cousin was struck by a chemical grenade of some sort (from what he tells me) and he is part of the Syrian army. If he is part of the Syrian army then it is obviously not Assad dealing with chemical weaponry for chemical warfare.

Read full topic

item.title: Syria's Use of Chemical Warfare
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

For those wondering what right wing Americans are supporting, check out the poll here: http://drudgereport.com/ Drudge is pretty much the biggest conservative news source in the US.

Obama is alone in his Syria decision because this time US citizens aren’t buying the hype.

Read full topic

item.title: Syria's Use of Chemical Warfare
item.dc:creator: @thiefmn6092 thiefmn6092
item.description:
@thiefmn6092 wrote:

i think the setting of a “red line” for chemical weapons usage was a bad idea. it gave other countries that advocated for action in syria a reason to try to forge evidence of a chemical attack (doesn’t mean there wasn’t one, however).

i see no reason for action in syria. it does not serve our interests whatsoever (and i am always one for serving our interests).

Read full topic

item.title: Syria's Use of Chemical Warfare
item.dc:creator: @hatem hatem
item.description:
@hatem wrote:

[quote=“Uncalled, post:1, topic:521648”]http://www.cnn.com/2013/06/13/politics/syria-us-chemical-weapons/

What do you guys think of this? And your thoughts about America’s intervening?[/quote]

First of all i would explain what is the story between Syria And USA.

Obama is searching for a small reason to hit Syria and he blames Assad that he using chemical weapons on its people and it wrong 100% because if he really did most of the villages will damage and its not. (i live their)
By the way Obama said he will hit Syria and he didn’t would u explain why ?
so take a care and understand that Obama is making a war, and it wont be a simple war it may be a world war because most of the countrys are joining this war.

Edit: Personally i live in Golan Heights and we are living like half of war, and it completing.

Read full topic

item.title: Syria's Use of Chemical Warfare

item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Muroth:

we’re over populated i think we should let some middle easterns kill each other

“we’re over populated” “they should kill each other”

Without being a pedant about your English, let us ignore the convenient fact that Syria is 0.64% the size of China, India, United States, Indonesia and Brazil.

item.title: Syria's Use of Chemical Warfare
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“loganownsyou, post:5, topic:521648”][quote author=xEthanx link=topic=640161.msg4317857#msg4317857 date=1371781198]

What do you guys think of this? And your thoughts about America’s intervening?

I think that America intervening is would be a very ignorant yet probable thing that will happen. I mean the fact is we here in America have not only the largest military in the world, but we have a military that’s larger than the next 24 countries on that list COMBINED. 23 of whom, are our allies. The best thing for America to do at this point is to mind its own damn business unless someone makes a genuine threat.
[/quote]

You just made all of that up… Where are your facts? america has a budget of like 682 billion, which is leading. The next maybe 5-7 people on this list combined make that up. We have a huge budget yes, but china has the largest amount of man-power hands down.

http://www.globalfirepower.com/active-military-manpower.asp[/quote]either way we going to make stuff go BOOM BOOM

Read full topic

item.title: Syria's Use of Chemical Warfare
item.dc:creator: @N_A_W_R_A_S N A W R A S
item.description:
@N_A_W_R_A_S wrote:

My thoughts as a Syrian whose living in the UAE, I don’t care who used it, JUST PLEASE LEAVE THE CIVILIANS ALONE, no matter what happens, we the people suffer from it (unfortunately).

But I don’t think the government would ever want to use the chemical weapons though… And I don’t think they used it, They stated before they won’t use it unless a Military intervention happens against Syria.
Any Military intervention against Syria will lead the region to a crisis. Even Russia declared their intention of going against any Military intervention against Syria.

Man I haven’t visited Syria for almost 3 years now… Since I was a kid, I never liked politics and politicians…

Read full topic

item.title: Syria's Use of Chemical Warfare
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

Bowser jr:

No. Both sides are accused for using chemical weapons, and why make that the red line? If anything we should support Assad.

Indeed it does appear that Assad is the less of two evils. We need to seek diplomatic solutions to said problems and if we can’t do it just leave them alone, the only thing that will come out of this is that more Syrian civilians will die. I hate to reduce this to a number game but it is, less people will die under Assad.

Read full topic

item.title: Syria's Use of Chemical Warfare
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

CNN

White House: Syria crosses 'red line' with use of chemical weapons -...

Syria has crossed a "red line" with its use of chemical weapons, including the nerve agent sarin gas, against rebels, a move that is prompting the United States to increase the "scale and scope" of its support for the opposition, the White House said...

What do you guys think of this? And your thoughts about America’s intervening?

Read full topic
